revised_title: High-Resolution Scanning Tunnelling Microscopy of Imperfect Carbon Cage Structures of C\lt;sub\gt;60\lt;/sub\gt;
tldr: The authors used high-resolution scanning tunnelling microscopy to study the atomic-level morphology of imperfect carbon cage structures of C60 clusters. Their observations confirmed the presence of various defect structures predicted by molecular dynamics simulations, providing a direct confirmation of the theoretical predictions. The tunnelling spectra showed a reduced gap between the highest occupied molecular orbitals and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbitals for clusters with defects.
